main event: A UFO was observed in Warren, Michigan on 17 August 1958. The sighting lasted for 6-10 minutes, with the object moving slowly towards WSW before eventually disappearing. It was described as a bright, metallic, circular object and was ultimately classified as unidentified.
interesting points: The UFO was initially observed as a bright metallic circular object and was reported to be the size of a dime when viewed with the naked eye.
The object was inactive for approximately seven to eight minutes before becoming active and eventually disappearing towards the WSW direction.
The sighting included detailed descriptions of the appearance and movement of the object, including its circularized and ring-shaped features.
No sound was reported from the object, and it appeared extremely bright, even brighter than Venus or other stars.
The UFO vanished out of sight within 10 seconds, fading very rapidly without noticeable diminishment in size.
